text: فلله الحمد رب السموت ورب الارض رب العلمين

translations.translation: All praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, Lord of all the worlds.
All praise be to God, Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, Lord of all the worlds.
So all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the heavens, the Lord of the earth, the Lord of the whole Universe.
It is only God, Lord of the heavens and the earth and Lord of the Universe who deserves all praise.
So all praise is for Allah only, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, the Lord of the Creation!
So all praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, and the Lord of all that exists.
Therefore to Allah is due (all) praise, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, the Lord of the worlds.
So to God belongs praise, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, Lord of all Being.
Then praise be to Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, the Lord of the Worlds.
Praise, then, be to God, Lord of the heavens, and Lord of the earth, the Lord of all the worlds.
All praise, then, Unto Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.
So all praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, the Lord of all the worlds.
Then Praise be to Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth,- Lord and Cherisher of all the Worlds!
So all the praises and thanks are to Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, and the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).
Praise, belongs to Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Worlds.
Praise belongs to God; Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, Lord of humanity.
Then, to Allah belongs [all] praise - Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.

[45:36] So to God belongs [all] praise, the attribution to Him of what is beautiful [in words] for fulfilling His promise regarding the deniers; Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, the Lord of the Worlds, the Creator of all that has been mentioned (‘ālam, ‘world’, denotes everything other than God; it is in the plural [‘ālamīn] because of the different types [of beings] in them; rabbi, ‘Lord’, [in the last clause] is a substitution [for the previous ones]).

(Then praise be to Allah) gratitude and favour belong to Allah, (Lord of the heavens and Lords of the earth) the Creator of the heavens and the earth, (the Lord of the Worlds) and Lord of all that has a soul which moves about on the surface of the earth.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
وله أن يثيب ويعاقب عباده على مقتضى فضله وعدله { فَلِلَّهِ } على وجه الاختصاص لا لغيره من الوسائل والأسباب العادية { ٱلْحَمْدُ } المستوجب لجمع الأثنية
 والمحامد الصادرة من ألسنة ذرائر مظاهره
 لكونه { رَبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ } أي: العلويات { وَرَبِّ ٱلأَرْضِ } أي: السفليات
 ورب ما يتركب منهما من الممتزجات
 وبالجملة: { رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ } [الجاثية: 36] أي: مربي الكل
 هو بذاته علواً وسفلاً
 بسيطاً ومركباً
 غيباً وشهادةً


{ وَلَهُ ٱلْكِبْرِيَآءُ } والعظمة { فِي ٱلسَّمَاوَاتِ وَٱلأَرْضِ } تدبيراً وتصرفاً
 حلاً وعقداً

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ فللّه الحمدُ } خاصة
 { ربّ السماوات وَربّ الأرض ربّ العالمين } فلا يستحق الحمد أحد سواه
 أي: فاحمدوا الله الذي هو ربكم ورب كل شيء
 فإن مثل هذه الربوبية العامة
 توجب الحمد والثناء على كل مربوب
 وتكرير الرب للتأكيد والإيذان بأن ربوبيته تعالى لكل منهما بطريق الأصالة
 { وله الكبرياءُ في السماوات والأرض } أي: وكبّروه
 فقد ظهرت آثار كبريائه وعظمته في السموات والأرض
 وإظهارهما في موضع الإضمار لتخفيم شأن الكبرياء
